decks.notes: This deck revolves around assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine) to quickly generate massive amounts of mana and play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out games. Overall, the deck aims to control the game with its powerful threats and disruption spells to overpower the opponent.

The main idea of the deck is to generate mana with rituals and medallions, cast powerful storm cards like Grapeshot and Artist's Talent, and then use different spells to bring those cards back from the graveyard, allowing for explosive combos that can deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its storm count and win the game before they have a chance to respond. The variety of cantrips and draw spells mixed with the ability to recur key pieces makes the deck consistent and versatile.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts to the battlefield and utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur them. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of artifacts and aggressive creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. The deck also includes cards like Tormod's Crypt and Pithing Needle to disrupt graveyard and activated ability strategies, allowing the aggro elements to push through for victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly and efficiently attacking the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to close out games. With a mix of aggression, removal, and resilience, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and powerful instant removal to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The deck features a mix of multicolor creatures and spells to utilize the Leyline cards effectively. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco are key creatures for early aggression, while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support for the aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial allows for efficient removal and disruption of the opponent's game plan. Teferi, Time Raveler offers additional control options and flexibility in the deck's gameplay.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing artifacts to gain incremental advantages and disrupt opponents while using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Engineered Explosives to control the battlefield. Urza's Saga provides valuable tokens and the ability to tutor for essential artifacts, maximizing efficiency. With a mix of artifact creatures and artifact-focused spells, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly through a combination of board presence and disruption, making it a formidable Aggro-Affinity archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional damage and control. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient creatures, backed up by powerful removal and disruption spells to secure a victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by using various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. The deck also includes a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide additional support. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck can generate card advantage and protect its own threats. Overall, the goal is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition while keeping the opponent's threats in check.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm opponents. It also utilizes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Galvanic Discharge to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck includes control elements like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while continuously applying pressure with powerful creatures, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of aggression and control.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Combo by ramping up mana with cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to cheat out high-cost creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Griselbrand. Utilizing spells like Generous Ent and Nourishing Shoal, the deck can gain life to cast free spells and protect the combo with Pact of Negation. The deck also includes cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Veil of Summer to provide additional protection and support. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combo off for a decisive victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize a toolbox of creatures to generate mana and create a powerful board presence. By using Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Devoted Druid, players can quickly ramp up their mana production. Additionally, Leyline of Abundance and Nature's Rhythm provide additional mana acceleration to help bring out big creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. Karn, the Great Creator can shut down opponents with his abilities, while Ouroboroid and Delighted Halfling add resilience and versatility to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents with a strong creature presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts like Ornithopter and Mox Opal to quickly build a board presence and power out large threats like Arcbound Ravager and Thought Monitor. It also includes card draw spells like Thoughtcast to maintain momentum. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast start and aggressive creatures, while leveraging the synergy between artifacts and cards like Cranial Plating and Urza's Saga to push through damage and secure the win as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize creatures as a toolbox, using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for key creatures like Vizier of Remedies and Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also focuses on generating mana with Leyline of Abundance and Devoted Druid to power out big threats like Spider Manifestation and Ouroboroid. By combining efficient mana generation and powerful creature toolbox options, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the opponent's board and tempo. By using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as threats, and cards like Quantum Riddler and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory provide additional control elements, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive game plan while keeping the opponent off balance. The deck aims to win through a combination of creature damage and disruption.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to put pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory to control the board and deal additional damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and burn spells, while also providing some protection with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Thraben Charm. Additionally, the inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah can serve as powerful finishers to close out the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to assemble UrzaTron - Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Power Plant - to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as control spells like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Chalice of the Void. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control over the game.
